New Records: At 1 hour, 48 minutes, it was the majors’ fastest nine-inning game since Armando Galarraga nearly threw a perfect game for Detroit against Cleveland on June 2, 2010. That game was completed in 1 hour, 44 minutes.
It was the fastest nine-inning game for the Cubs since they finished a 3-0 victory over the Reds in 1 hour, 48 minutes on May 24, 2001, at Wrigley, according to the Elias Sports Bureau.
Key Match Events: Jameson Taillon threw seven crisp innings in his second straight win, allowing four hits, striking out two, and walking two.
Tyson Miller got three outs before Porter Hodge finished the four-hitter for his eighth save.
Nico Hoerner hit a leadoff double, advanced to third on Pete Crow-Armstrong’s sacrifice bunt, and scored on Miguel Amaya’s sacrifice fly.
Nick Martinez pitched a five-hitter for his first career complete game, despite the Reds' loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Jameson Taillon reflected on his performance, stating, 'I had a little bit of a rough patch there in like early, mid-August. To be able to bounce back from that and finish strong is a good feeling.'
Reds interim manager Freddie Benavides commented on the challenging wind conditions, saying, 'With the wind blowing in as hard as it was, it was a challenge.'
Cubs manager Craig Counsell praised third-base coach Willie Harris' decision to send Nico Hoerner on the tricky flyball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cubs right fielder Seiya Suzuki missed his second straight game due to an ankle injury, but manager Craig Counsell was optimistic he could play the next day.
